revised_title: A Theoretical Study of Paramagnetic Alums at Low Temperatures
tldr: This article presents a theoretical study of a possible model of paramagnetic alums at low temperatures. The authors propose a lattice of freely suspended magnetic dipoles as a first approximation to represent a paramagnetic alum. They discuss the configuration energy, partition function, and the critical temperature of the system, providing insights into the behavior of paramagnetic alums under various conditions.
